author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
From east like the rising sun, mid-week has sprung,
Strong dollar and Asian winds, the song unsung,
Yet, the steadfast metals, their worth tower high,
Against the arduous tides, towards the sky.

A saga unfolds in Sanofi's great hall,
Plans for spin-off, consumer-health's downfall,
Famed for its pharma, and scripts of pure gold,
Its focus hereafter, forefathers behold. 

Reckitt Benckiser, a ship amidst storm,
Downgrades approaching, in ill-favoured form,
NatWest speaks of weaker financial plight,
A tempest looming, cloaked deep in the night.

feedItems.title: Metals Set to Finish the Week Higher Despite Mixed Demand Signals, Strong Dollar
feedItems.description: Base metal prices are set to finish the week higher, despite mixed demand signals from Asia and a strong dollar acting as headwinds.

feedItems.title: Sanofi Plans to Spin Off Consumer-Healthcare, Pharma Businesses
feedItems.description: The move makes Sanofi the latest drugmaker to sharpen its focus on prescription medicines by offloading adjacent businesses.

feedItems.title: Reckitt Benckiser's Lack of Catalysts Prompts Downgrades
feedItems.description: NatWest’s consensus earnings expectations likely imply double-digit earnings downgrades to 2024 alongside a weaker capital outlook, according to Barclays.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Black gold ascends, amidst the desert's strife,
Its value braided in the folds of fear,
As goats that fear the snarling wolf, their life,
Ends not this dalliance dear.

The Dollar's dance is swaying, now unsure,
As dogs that turn to distant bugle's call,
In lands afar, their voices will allure,
Upon our ears they fall.

Shares in NatWest flutter like leaves in gale,
As rabbits startled by the falcon's swoop,
Their worth, alas, to tempest winds they sail,
In uncertainty they loop.

feedItems.title: Oil Gains as Middle East Tensions Rise
feedItems.description: Oil gained more than 1% as tensions in the Middle East continued to worry investors, with BMI predicting prices will trade $80-$95 a barrel over the remainder of 2023 and in early 2024.

feedItems.title: Dollar May Start to React Less to US Data, More to Data Elsewhere
feedItems.description: The dollar’s reaction to the stronger-than-expected U.S. GDP data was “quite muted” and it could, along with other currencies, start to react more to data outside of the U.S., such as the eurozone and China, than it has in recent weeks, ING said.

feedItems.title: NatWest Shares Slide After Profit Outlook Cut
feedItems.description: NatWest shares hit their lowest price since early 2021 after the bank cut its full-year net interest margin guidance and reported below-forecast profits in the third quarter.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Upon Eurozone's bond yields silent stand,
Monk Arnulfus doth not deeply understand.
Government bonds sounded, no selloffs sparred,
Like thick ale simmering, prospects barred.

IAG, firm in outlook, full of cheer,
Resounds like strong wine, crystal clear.
With profits rising, plump as a grape,
Their fortunes swift, in good shape.

Eni's outlook, now bright as golden mead,
Their success on parchment, scribes do read.
Boosted by exploration, the cash flow sings,
Praise be to God, who all good things brings!

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Stall Awaiting New Driver
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bonds were little changed and Abrdn said recessionary economic data would suggest lower yields, but selloffs in Treasurys have added upside pressure.

feedItems.title: IAG Confident on Outlook After Strong Third Quarter
feedItems.description: British Airways-owner IAG reported an above-forecast rise in third-quarter core profit, driven by strong leisure demand across all group airlines, and said it expected a solid recovery in 2023 with capacity nearing prepandemic levels.

feedItems.title: Eni Upgrades Outlook After Third-Quarter Beat
feedItems.description: Eni raised its full-year forecasts for operating profit and cash flow after third-quarter results topped analysts’ expectations, boosted by the exploration and production division.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Beneath the veil of darkened night, Remy Cointreau's plight,
Organic sales they do foresee, lessen by fifth or one of three.
Their market in the New World wanes, amidst fierce contests, losses gains,
High they soar, those interest rates, whilst distributors' funding waits.

A tale I weave now of CaixaBank's gain,
Profit has risen, easing strain.
Lending income's swelling tide, has brought a boon on autumn's ride,
Despite a portfolio’s dissent, still rosy are the dividends sent.

Naught but shadows cast their drape, on Covestro's evolving shape,
Lowered forecasts they now declare, earnings scarce in rarified air.
The environment proves hostile, sowing doubt on profit's aisle,
An arduous year their books confess, echoes of a business in distress.

feedItems.title: Remy Cointreau Slashes Guidance After Sales Slump
feedItems.description: Remy Cointreau forecast a 15%-20% decline in organic sales for fiscal 2024, saying market conditions had deteriorated in the U.S., citing a fiercely promotional environment and high interest rates that cut distributors’ financing capacity.

feedItems.title: CaixaBank Profit Boosted by Higher Lending Income
feedItems.description: CaixaBank reported a 19% rise in third-quarter profit on higher lending income and despite a decline in its loans portfolio.

feedItems.title: Covestro Trims Guidance Range
feedItems.description: Covestro lowered its full-year forecasts for underlying earnings and cash flow, citing a challenging environment that weighed on its third-quarter results.
